view

Class ButtonView

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.ElementView
      • view.ButtonView

  • public class ButtonView
extends ElementView
    Sub-specification for ElementView meant to represent a button. Its graphical representation can be either an open button or a closed button. Uses all functions made by its parent class but provides an image of a button, either open or closed. Also provides methods to switch between the open and closed states.
    Author:
    Teiki Pepin
    See Also:
    ElementView

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) java.lang.String closeButtonPath
      String containing the pathname to the closed button image file.
      (package private) java.lang.String openButtonPath
      String containing the pathname to the opened button image file.

    • Method Detail

      • getImageFile

        protected java.io.File getImageFile()
        Returns a File object that points to an image file representing a closed button. The File is meant to be used elsewhere in order to generate a proper sprite that can be printed on the screen. This also sets the pathnames for the closed button and the open button files so that they can be used later on.

        If the selected file doesn't exist, an empty File will be returned.

        Specified by:
        getImageFile in class ElementView
        Returns:
        a File object that contains an image of a closed button
        See Also:
        ElementView, File

      • openButton

        public void openButton()
        Updates the sprite of this object to one of an open button. It uses the field openButtonPath defined elsewhere to generate the File that is provided to its parent's updating method.

        If the selected file doesn't exist, an empty File will be provided.

        See Also:
        ElementView.updateSprite(File), File

      • closeButton

        public void closeButton()
        Updates the sprite of this object to one of a closed button. It uses the field closeButtonPath defined elsewhere to generate the File that is provided to its parent's updating method.

        If the selected file doesn't exist, an empty File will be provided.

        See Also:
        ElementView.updateSprite(File), File
